intro: Cryptantha insolita, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in dry, harsh environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
